page.title: 17Colston Bassett Primary
page.content: The school is C of controlled, closely linked with the parish church.There are 50 children(5-11yrs)with 2 and a half teachers.It is built of attractive grey stone and belongs to the estate. It looks like a house and has 2 classrooms with oak beams:the big one has an open fire.There is a kitchen,a cloakroom and an extension.We still ring the original bell which stands outside the door.The toilets are outside and we like to run across the yard where we play netball. We also have a 2 acre playing field for football and rounders and the use of an orchard.In summer we go down the farmer's fields to the dens in the old willow trees which the top sections have had for years.The younger children have dens nearer the school in the hollows under the hedge.
